name: Jazz Age Christmas at Spadina Museum
description:
Step back in time with a free visit to Spadina Museum, beautifully decorated for a 1920s Christmas. Visitors can enjoy the opulent holiday décor and period ambiance that once filled the home of the wealthy Austin family. Twinkling lights, antique ornaments, and rooms set for a classic Jazz Age celebration bring the spirit of the season to life. 

As you stroll through the mansion, interpretive displays offer insights into the lavish holiday traditions of Toronto's elite in the 1920s. In contrast, visitors will also learn about the experiences of the city's less fortunate citizens during the same era—those who faced poverty, unemployment, and food insecurity during a time of great social and economic change.

From a grand dining room prepared for a festive feast to modest depictions of how the servants of the household marked the holidays, the experience paints a full picture of a Toronto Christmas in the early 20th century.

name: New Vistas: Alder for the Heart
description: Uncover diverse perspectives of identity in the GTA through an exhibition that highlights the talent of early career visual artists. Curated by Humber College's Arts Administration & Cultural Management program.

name: Medusa
description:
Get ready to stomp your feet, laugh, cry, and hear sounds you've never heard before with this electrifying chamber-folk band.  

Some of their instruments are likely ones you've never seen before and that might shock your classical music scholars. 

These four folk musicians are reimagining the Western string quartet. Medusa cross-pollinates traditional music from around the world with original music, engaging stories, and their one-of-a-kind stringed instruments to create a "must-see live show!" (Sam Boer, Exclaim!). 

Its members are Georgia Hathaway, Lea Kirstein, Marta Sołek, and Saskia Tomkins.

name: Dashing through the Distillery District Scavenger Hunt
description:
Celebrate the beauty of one of the most enchanting corners of Toronto, in this holiday-themed game!

Explore the cobblestone paths searching for clues as you complete creative photo and video challenges that range from picturesque to hilarious and jolly. Race against the clock to find holiday clues, encounter singing carollers, and solve seasonal riddles all under a canopy of twinkling lights. 

Who will come out on top?

name: Among Neighbors
description:
Join us for the Toronto premiere of "Among Neighbors" (2025, 100 minutes), a gripping drama that illustrates the tensions and betrayals that unfolded in a small, rural Polish town.

Offering a stark and intimate portrait of the last living survivor from that town and an ageing eyewitness who saw Jews murdered by her own Polish neighbours. This powerful documentary shows how fear, prejudice, and silence can transform communities. Using interviews and hand-drawn animation, the film explores how the Holocaust unfolded in the streets and homes of ordinary towns.

name: Swipe Night
description:
Comedians will swipe through their dating apps live on the big screen. We'll vote on which way to swipe, compose silly messages, and have the best night out Toronto has ever seen.

Hosted by nice, quiet comedian, Sarah London (Sirius XM, Comedy Records) and featuring some of her funniest, most single friends.

name: Good Food Market Christmas Market

address.streetAddress: 425 King St. E. Toronto, ON, M5A 1L3

description:
We are excited to present the second annual Little Trinity Christmas Market, in collaboration with our regular Good Food Market! On December 3, we will host a special Christmas market featuring affordable homemade baked goods, handmade cards, and beautiful gifts, alongside our usual fresh produce.

Come out and enjoy:
* Live Music, come enjoy seasonal performances by Dr. Ben!
* Free Goodies: Take a load off and enjoy complimentary hot chocolate, apple cider, and yummy treats!
* Unique Gifts: Do your holiday shopping and pick up some unique hand-made gifts for your loved ones!
* Groceries: Stop by our regular produce market, offering high quality fruits and veggies at wholesale prices!

All proceeds will go to Good Shepherd Ministries, a local organization that serves over 1000 meals a day to those in need.

name: Tylor Jay Santos live at DROM Taberna
description: Tylor Jay Santos is a singer/songwriter blending and borrowing sounds of soul and blues, to post-punk and alternative. The storytelling nature of Tylor's work is the through line, often harkening heartbreak and deep yearning. Coming off his recent Bandcamp exclusive EP "True Blue", he continues to explore new sounds, while reckoning with his past, in his vulnerable and stripped state, with his voice and a guitar

name: Mike T Kerr live at DROM Taberna
description: Hot Swing, Jump Blues, Country Music
